meanings.definition: Relating to the combined effects of heat and magnetism.
meanings.sent1: The thermomagnetic material changed its properties when exposed to heat and a magnet.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted experiments to understand the thermomagnetic behavior of the substance.
meanings.sent3: The thermomagnetic reaction was so surprising that it made the researchers double-check their equipment.
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with thermomagnetic phenomena was like a magnetic pull, drawing her deeper into the study.
meanings.sent5: The thermomagnetic effect was as clear as day, making it easy for students to observe and learn from.

meanings.sent1: The thermomagnetic was used in the construction of the new device.
meanings.sent2: The researchers analyzed the thermomagnetic to understand its unique characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The thermomagnetic seemed to have a mind of its own, reacting unexpectedly in the experiment.
meanings.sent4: The thermomagnetic material was a hidden gem, waiting to be discovered by scientists.
meanings.sent5: The properties of the thermomagnetic made it stand out among other materials in the lab.

meanings.sent1: Her research focused on the thermomagnetic and its applications in technology.
meanings.sent2: The thermomagnetic field was a fascinating area of study for many scientists.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for thermomagnetic research was contagious among the students.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the depths of thermomagnetic phenomena was like diving into a mysterious ocean.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on thermomagnetic phenomena made the complex topic easier to understand for beginners.
